item.title: Grace add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "There is divine beauty in learning... To learn means to accept the postulate that life did not begin at my birth. Others have been here before me, and I walk in their footsteps. The books I have read were composed by generations of fathers and sons, mothers and daughters, teachers and disciples. I am the sum total of their experiences, their quests. And so are you." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Grace add a quote by Robert Southey
item.description: "Give me a room whose every nook is dedicated to a book." -- Robert Southey

item.title: Grace add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "The dearest ones of time, the strongest friends of the soul--BOOKS." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Grace add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
